description: CLEVELAND, April 3  After nearly a decade without a national championship during creeping parity in womens college basketball, Tennessee has reasserted itself as a dynasty.

title: Shackles on the AIDS Program
description: An expert committee has found that the Bush administrations ambitious program to combat AIDS abroad is off to a good start but warns that restrictions imposed by Congress or by the administration are hampering efforts to slow the spread of the epidemic. These inflexible barriers are often imposed for ideological, not health reasons.

title: Senators Pensions Draw Fire in Trenton
description: TRENTON, April 3  This year, the New Jersey Senate is facing its biggest turnover in two decades, with nearly a third of its 40 members saying they plan to retire.

title: Whats on Tonight
description: 9 P.M. (2) NOVEL REFLECTIONS ON THE AMERICAN DREAM There was a time when the countrys collective ambitions  and subsequent despairs  were fodder for great literature. Take John Steinbecks Grapes of Wrath, which confronted an inconvenient truth: it sometimes takes more than hard work and clean living to get ahead. When it was published in 1939, the novel was criticized as being full of lies, corruption and Communistic themes. It sold out in a flash. This special looks at seven stories that dared to challenge the fiction of the American dream: works from Theodore Dreisers Sister Carrie and Edith Whartons House of Mirth to F. Scott Fitzgeralds Great Gatsby (above, a scene from a re-enactment) and Saul Bellows Seize the Day. Passages from each book are dramatized through still photography, animation and archival film; Patricia Clarkson narrates.

title: Sidetracked Again
description: Carbondale, Ill.

title: Backyard Pests? Think of Them as Dinner
description: FOR a big dinner party he gave in New York last week, Steven Rinella, who has lived in the city only since August, had trouble assembling some of the stuff he needed. He just about gave up on potassium nitrate, for example, which he wanted to use in curing a black bear ham he intended to smoke in a homemade smoker improvised from plywood and an electric hotplate. Then, at the last minute, a friend of his girlfriends, prowling drug stores, found a bottle with an expiration date of 1985. The druggist let her have it for nothing.

title: Flashy Wrestling Shows Grab the World by the Neck and Flex
description: DETROIT, April 3  Quick, name the biggest events in global pop culture during the last week.

title: Keeping Passover, Easter and a Space to Park
description: In a city that has done the alternate-side parking dance since the days of sock hops, Eren Hock knew just what she had found as soon as she put the transmission in park and turned off the engine on Monday: a space on her Manhattan block where she could leave her car for up to 11 days.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 3, 2007

title: Vermont Becomes Offshore Insurance Haven
description: At conferences of the offshore insurance industry, next to the booth for Bermuda, can often be found one promoting Vermont.

title: McCain Revamps His Fund-Raising
description: WASHINGTON, April 3  Lagging in fund-raising and under fire for his support of the Iraq war, Senator John McCain is overhauling his campaign finance operation and delaying the official announcement of his candidacy, his aides said Tuesday.

title: So, Hard Work and Virtue Guarantee Success? Dream On
description: Care to watch a novel or two? Novel Reflections on the American Dream presents seven of them tonight, by writers from Theodore Dreiser to Saul Bellow, in a fast-moving presentation of the American Masters series on PBS.

title: Will a Hedge Fund Become the Next Goldman Sachs?
description: IN 1988, a very young-looking 19-year-old Harvard student sneaked past the receptionist at the Boston office of Merrill Lynch, found the manager in charge of convertible bonds and struck up a conversation about the technical aspects of valuing those bonds.

title: Shareholders of Nikko Cordial Start a Campaign to Force Citigroup to Raise Its Offer
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, April 4 (Bloomberg News)  Shareholders of the brokerage firm Nikko Cordial have started a campaign to force Citigroup to raise its takeover offer of $13.4 billion for the firm, placing sell orders in the market at a higher price.

title: New Call for Justice in Poison Case
description: LONDON, April 3  The widow and associates of Alexander V. Litvinenko, who was poisoned in London in November, said Tuesday that they had established a foundation to demand justice and expressed worries that Britain and Russia might allow his killers to avoid trial.

title: Queens: Man Charged With 4 Burglaries
description: A Jackson Heights man was charged yesterday with four break-ins in northern Queens in the past year, prosecutors said. The man, Antonio Diaz, 36, of 34th Road, is accused of stealing thousands of dollars in cash, laptop computers and electronic equipment from homes, said Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said Mr. Diaz drilled through door locks or climbed through windows after residents had left for work. Mr. Diaz pleaded not guilty to burglary in Criminal Court, prosecutors said.

title: Stay on Track
description: Americans made 10.1 billion trips on public transportation last year, the highest that ridership has risen in nearly half a century. Thats good for congestion on the roads as well as the pollution that goes with it. But any mass-transit renaissance will come to a grinding halt unless a commensurate investment is made in upkeep and expansion.

title: Hammer, Nails, Dry Rot and Do-It-Yourself Trouble
description: Once again placing his gangsta credentials in serious jeopardy, the rapper Ice Cube returns to the multiplex with Are We Done Yet?, an ill-advised sequel to Are We There Yet? and a feeble fable of better parenting through home improvement.

title: DoubleClick to Set Up an Exchange for Buying and Selling Digital Ads
description: DOUBLECLICK, which delivers marketing messages to Web sites and monitors how many clicks they get, plans to announce today that it is setting up a Nasdaq-like exchange for the buying and selling of digital advertisements.

title: Nuclear Drill Performance Raises Issues on Safety
description: WASHINGTON, April 3  As a simulated nuclear accident unfolded at a Georgia power plant, the drill called for a pump shaft to break and to dump metal parts into the reactor coolant system.

title: The Comeback of Condrieus Is the Story of a Singular Grape
description: FEW Old World wine regions offer so dramatic a story of success as the resurrection of Condrieu.

title: A Classic, Updated
description: After more than 100 years, Lodge, a maker of cast-iron cookware, has added a new line, the Signature Series, with stainless steel handles. That may not sound like much, but it means that the handles stay cooler for stovetop cooking and that the look is more 21st-century.

title: Iowa Librarys Cat Has a Rich Second Life as a Biography
description: Watch out, Marley.

title: Ukraines Premier Defies Order to Dissolve Parliament
description: MOSCOW, April 3  Prime Minister Viktor F. Yanukovich and his cabinet remained defiant Tuesday, resisting an order by Ukraines president, Viktor A. Yushchenko, to disband the Parliament, while thousands gathered near the Parliament building in support of the prime minister.

title: Man Queried in Killings of Prostitutes
description: ALLOWAY TOWNSHIP, N.J., April 3  Investigators have been questioning a Salem County man and searching his home in connection with the killings of four prostitutes whose bodies were found near Atlantic City in November, according to an official who has been briefed on the case and the mans sister.

title: With Corzines Signature, Taxpayers Burden Lightens
description: TRENTON, April 3  Culminating a nine-month effort to bring some measure of relief to property owners in New Jersey, Gov. Jon S. Corzine on Tuesday signed into law the centerpiece of a package of bills that will give a tax credit of up to 20 percent to homeowners and force municipalities to cap annual local tax increases at 4 percent.

title: Blair Seeking Diplomatic Solution to Iran Standoff
description: LONDON, April 3  Prime Minister Tony Blair said Tuesday that he was still hoping to secure through diplomatic means the release of the 15 British sailors and marines captured by Iran, and that the next 48 hours would be fairly critical in resolving the dispute.

title: 8-Month Jail Term Ends as Maker of Video Turns Over a Copy
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 3  Eight months after he went to jail for refusing to turn over a videotape of a violent protest to federal authorities, a freelance videographer and blogger was released on Tuesday, ending what has been called the longest incarceration ever of an American journalist.

title: Food for the Gods, and Everyone Else
description: GANESHA, the multiarmed, one-tusked, elephant-headed son of Shiva, is one of the most beloved gods in the Hindu pantheon and the presiding deity at the Hindu Temple Society of North America in Flushing, Queens.

title: Correction: $25 and Under
description: The $25 and Under column last Wednesday, about the Colombian restaurant Las Americas in Queens, referred incorrectly to a region of Colombia that is home to a dish called bandejas Paisa. People who live in Antioquia and other northwestern provinces are colloquially known as Paisas, and the area is known as the Paisa region, but the area is not called Paisa.

title: Old Buildings Getting a Face-Lift for Homeless Veterans
description: LOS ANGELES, April 3  Right now, they hardly seem the makings of living space, the abandoned halls and vacant rooms of Buildings 4 and 5 on the Veterans Affairs campus in the San Fernando Valley.

title: N.J. Pension Fund Endangered by Diverted Billions
description: In 2005, New Jersey put either $551 million, $56 million or nothing into its pension fund for teachers. All three figures appeared in various state documents  though the state now says that the actual amount was zero.

title: India: Hershey Is Forming a Joint Venture
description: The Hershey Company said it was forming a joint venture in India with Godrej Beverages and Foods to manufacture and sell confections, snacks and beverages. Hershey said it would invest $60 million and take a 51 percent stake in the venture, which will be called Godrej Hershey. The rest of the venture will be held by Godrej Industries, a privately held conglomerate that is the parent company of Godrej Beverages. Through the venture, Hershey, based in Hershey, Pa., will obtain access to Godrejs two factories and 1.6 million retail outlets. Godrej Beverages, which makes juices, soy milk and cooking oils, has annual sales of $70 million. Richard H. Lenny, Hersheys chief executive, above, called the deal a significant step in Hersheys global growth strategy. Production is expected to start in 2008.

title: Another Dr. King Auction, and His Heirs Are Unhappy
description: ATLANTA, April 3  Less than a year after a dramatic eleventh-hour deal by a coalition of civic leaders saved a large trove of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.s papers and personal items from the auction block, a new cache of his documents has surfaced for sale to the highest bidder.

title: Asias Automakers Show Sizable March Sales Gains
description: Detroits automakers stumbled in March while their Asian competitors took a sizable leap forward.

title: After the Buyouts, Lawyers Prepare to Wrap Bandages
description: AS the chiefs of private equity pull off one highflying buyout after another, bankruptcy lawyers are beginning to get their safety nets and first-aid kits ready.

title: Newark Shootings Kill 2 and Injure 7
description: NEWARK, April 3  Two people were killed and seven were wounded in six shootings here on Tuesday that the authorities said did not appear to be related.

title: Queens: Man Sentenced for 2 Rapes
description: A man who posed as an investigator to lure two women to Queens motels and forced them to have sex with him was sentenced yesterday in State Supreme Court to 15 years in prison, prosecutors said. The man, Eric McCoy, 37, of Beach 26th Street in Far Rockaway, pleaded guilty on Feb. 26 to first-degree rape, said Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said Mr. McCoy, posing as an investigator on both occasions, told the women that they were under investigation and ordered them to accompany him to a motel for questioning. He said Mr. McCoy beat one of the women and threatened each with arrest if they did not have sex with him.

title: Thai Military Government Blocks YouTube Access
description: BANGKOK, April 4  Thailands military-appointed government has blocked Internet users in the country from gaining access to YouTube and several other Web sites because of content that it says is offensive, officials said today.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 3,247 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans yesterday:

title: U.S. Accuses Part of Tax Chain of Fraud
description: The Justice Department took steps yesterday to shut down a big piece of the Jackson Hewitt tax-preparation empire, charging that more than 165 of its stores enabled tens of thousands of middle- and lower-income people to fraudulently obtain $70 million by falsifying their federal tax returns.

title: Nonprofit Doesnt Mean You Cant Wheel and Deal
description: Running the Urban Justice Center  an organization founded more than two decades ago to advocate for New Yorks homeless population  might not seem like the best credential for making a killing in real estate.

title: Trans-Atlantic Exchange to Be Listed Today
description: PARIS, April 3  The chiefs of the merged New York Stock Exchange and Euronext said Tuesday, on the eve of the opening day of trading of its shares, that they were determined to create a truly global market that would include operations in China.

title: Eddie Robinson, College Coach, Dies
description: Eddie Robinson, who in 55 seasons at Grambling State University in Louisiana became the first college football coach to win more than 400 football games, more than any other college coach in history, died on Tuesday in Ruston, La. He was 88.His death was confirmed to The Associated Press by Doug Williams, one of his former players, who became a Super Bowl M.V.P. He had entered the hospital earlier Tuesday. The cause of death was not immediately announced but he had been in declining health since learning he had Alzheimers disease in 2004.

description: To the Editor:

title: Smithsonian Scrambles to Regain Its Footing
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  As the Smithsonians museum directors filed into a conference room at the organizations headquarters here Wednesday for their monthly meeting, Cristin Samper had some difficulty getting in the door. Thats because so many people stopped him in the hallway to shake his hand and wish him luck. I feel like Im on a receiving line, he said.

title: Opposition to Electronic Voting System Grows in France
description: PARIS, April 3  For Frances Socialists, among others, the coming presidential election could descend into a nightmare like last falls in Florida.

title: Bush Defies Democrats With 3 Appointments
description: WASHINGTON, April 4  President Bush used Congresss Easter break today to defy Democratic lawmakers and appoint three officials who have already drawn heavy criticism on Capitol Hill.

title: Artifacts Tied to Steroids Find Place in Halls Museum
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  If Barry Bonds climbs within a handful of homers of Hank Aarons record of 755 this season, Jeff Idelson of the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum will become his shadow. Once Bonds moves close to Aaron, Idelson will leave here to be closer to Bonds in hopes of securing some worthwhile mementos.

title: French Train Breaks Rail Speed Record
description: BEZANNES, France, April 3  A French high-speed train broke the world speed record on rail on Tuesday, reaching 357 miles an hour (574.8 kilometers) in a much publicized test in eastern France, exceeding expectations that it would hit 150 meters a second, or 540 kilometers an hour.

As a result, he has the potential to change the way more New Yorkers eat  whether in the haughtiest dining rooms or the poorest home kitchens  than all the citys food activists and restaurant critics combined.

description: Faded but stately, crumbling but proud, the walled city of Fez might well be the largest and most enduring medieval Islamic settlement in the world.
